definition: national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria

sentences.english: After the unequal treaties made, all records of the Chinese national humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 不平等條約訂立的經過，全爲中國國恥的記錄。

sentences.english: The seizure of American hostages in Iran sharpened the pain of national humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗扣押美國人質的行動加劇了國恥的痛苦。

sentences.english: Indelible history, can not forget national humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 歷史不可磨滅，國恥不能忘卻。

sentences.english: Mr Putin seems to regard foreign debt as a sort of national insult, and is paying most of it off.
sentences.chinese: 普京似乎將外債視爲國恥，因此正在償還其中的大半。

definition: variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to take revenge for a past insult/to expunge a disgrace or humiliation
to have a sense of shame
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
Tai'erzhuang district of Zaozhuang city 棗莊市|枣庄市[Zao3 zhuang1 shi4], Shandong
to impose martial law/to impose emergency measures
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
